page.title: 13Quantock Birds
page.content: The mewing {Buzzard}circling over the combes, sometimes being mobbed by{ {Jackdaws,}is a familiar sight as is also the hovering {Kestrel }and the soaring {Meadow Pipit }but less common is the {Hobby}hunting {Swallows}or { {House Martins.}Perching on gorse the{ {Stonechat }is usually first heard clinking while the {Whinchat}sings to defend its territory.The {pheasant} announces the coming sonic boom of concode and the {Green wood pecker}and {wood pigeon}fly from Hodders combe. Although the{cuckoo}is eagerly awaited each April the {Nightjar}is just as a welcome if a more secretive visitor.In summer it can be heard at night together with the {Little Owl }and { {tawney Owl }calls, churring on Longstone Hill.{Redshank,Snipe and {Curlew}are winter visitors.
